name: Rome Cavalieri, Waldorf Astoria Hotels & Resorts

reviews.title: Beatiful, expensive, and worth every penny!
reviews.text: We just completed a 3 night stay at the Rome Cavalieri Hilton on June 19th. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. Set on a hillside above the city, in a quite residential area, this hotel is amazing inside and out. It is a bit of a distance to the city itself, but the hotel provides an hourly shuttle to a good central point where walking and the metro are easily accessible. The shuttle stop is within walking distance of almost all the major attractions in Rome. The Coliseum was the furtherst, at about 30 minutes. For us, seeing the Rome is what we were there for, so the walk was never an issue.

reviews.title: As Advertised
reviews.text: The rooms were very spacious and reminded us of the Venetian in Las Vegas. The staff were very responsive.
The interior is almost completely marble. The hallway walls were even marble!
reviews.title: Special Spot

likes.liked: — Luxurious room, great service, decadent spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with other hotels in Italy, familes of 4 need 2 rooms or a suite. For some reason, these rooms that could easily accommodate 4-5 people have a 3 person limit.
reviews.title: Great hotel - wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise, we were simply amazed.
reviews.title: Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights using my points. I am only a GOLD member and it showed when we checked in. They gave us a "city view" room. When we looked out our room it was on the 3rd floor looking into shrubs also they would not give us access to the executive lounge nor move us up to a higher floor as we were on our honeymoon. Over all a good hotel, but not worth $450.00 US. Thank god we used points. Don't stay here if you want to stay out in the downtown area after 8. Over all - over rated...
reviews.title: Wonderful Room, Average Service...

likes.disliked: — Treated like Teenagers on Spring Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed one night at the Cavalieri Hilton and thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. I wished I had booked this hotel for my entire visit. When I was initially booking, I was thrown off by its location description – it’s on top of a hill away from the busy city center. But with that you get this terrific view of the city and resort feel. Not to mention they have shuttles that take you to the city every hour. The shuttle is new and clean and takes no more than 15 minutes to get you into the city. Also, it’s a cheap taxi ride to the Vatican. They have a couple pools – one indoors. The pool area is manned by two pool attendants that service your every needs (plush pillows beds, towels, umbrellas, etc) and wait staff to provide you with refreshments. Also, the turkish bath in the spa is wonderful after a long day of sightseeing. Simply the best hotel and spa in Rome.
reviews.title: AMAZING - Absolutely adored this resort with great views and spa!

likes.liked: — Accomodations, location and service were excellent - not your typical hilton!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful treat. Staff were exceptional, friendly helpful and efficient.
reviews.title: Gorgeous!

reviews.text: Beautiful surroundings. Great bus service into and out of the city.
reviews.title: Relaxed luxury in Rome

reviews.text: Cant wait to visit again.
reviews.title: A FairyTale

likes.liked: — The rare elegance of the hotel and the outstanding service of the hotel staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner took me to the Waldorf Cavalieri for a 4 day romantic relaxing trip. A hotel set above from the best, cannot fault the amazing view overlooking the city of Rome, breath taking set 150 feet above Rome, I don't believe that you could want a better view.
reviews.title: The price of luxury was worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are friendly and multilingual which is always a plus, very attentive and helpful, you need for nothing. As for the rooms we stayed on the 6th floor and again as soon as you step it the eloquent and design of the room is amazing a well sized suite, beds are so comfortable and pillows are out of this world. If you are hoping to book for the 3 star Michelin restaurant on the 9th floor I would suggest that this is done as soon as possible it was very unfortunate that it was all booked up while we were there and it is closed on Sundays and Mondays.
reviews.title: Resort Living in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of everything else a princess could want for nothing, to set the standards the Juventus Football team stayed there while we were there so best for the best.
reviews.title: Rome Cavalieri- Rome, A Waldorf Property

reviews.text: There is a shuttle bus that takes you into town so that you can get easy access to the attractions, also the Metro will take you to destinations.
reviews.title: An expensive luxury hotel

reviews.text: My only gripe is as below even though my partner put it into perspective was that it was overly expensive. However the final consensus is that you have to pay for first class luxury. There is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room, no iron WIFI is not free actually 25.00 euro per night, the mini bar is not even to be looked at, basically if you are watching the pennies not the hotel for people without very deep pockets.
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing place. The food in the restaurant is to die for albeit pricey. Two sandwiches and a pot of tea 28 pounds.(room service).
reviews.title: Wow!!!

reviews.text: Balcony overlooked Vatican.
reviews.title: Genuine 5* Hotel and 5* Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are plush plush plush.
reviews.title: Great Property Exceeds Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Taxi ride to centre of Rome, traffic hell anytime of day.
reviews.title: Holiday Weekend Away

reviews.text: Really special stay. Well worth the money.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: As usual the service and cleanliness at this hotel was impeccable!
reviews.title: Another great stay at this hotel
A "5" star hotel with several negative issues
reviews.text: Great view of Rome, fantastic concierge food daily.
This hotel goes out of its way to accomadate your every need.
reviews.title: One of the nicest hotels I have stayed at

reviews.text: The only thing I would say is as it was Easter although the hotel didn't seem that busy the spa must have been or the staff was off because for the 4 day period I was there I was unable to get a appointment in the spa.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: This hotel is on the outskirts of Rome, with lovely views of the city, if you have a room at the back. The front of the hotel overlooks a massive electronics tower; rather horrible to wake up to every day.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in Rome

reviews.text: What a Hotel! We stayed as a Diamond member on the 7th floor of the hotel. For the 7th floor to the 9th there is a free lounge with snacks and drinks from 0700-2300 which is a real benifit considering everything in the hotel is expensive. You can see the entire city and all the sites while sipping your wine. There is a free shuttle that takes you right downtown from 0830 to 2000 and you can walk or take the subway just about anywhere you would like to go. You can walk about 3 blocks down the street from the hotel to 3 resturaunts and some shopping. Great place!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hilton Cavalieri 5 nights and it was just perfect! I must honestly say that thanks to our Hilton diamond membership status we got an upgrade to the executive floor/lounge - which made our trip even more perfect! However, having been a flight attendant I have seen lots of hotels but Hilton Cavalieri in Rome goes beyond all expectations. If you want to get spoilt or have some luxury around you, go here!
reviews.title: Perfect perfect perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location may be out of town however, a complimentary shuttle service downtown takes approx 25min and is running quite frequently (last bus to hotel leaves town 8pm). From the hotel and its meditteranean park you have a gorgeous view of the city. The park is beautiful, excellent place to relax after sightseeing all day, just like the pool and restaurants in the hotel. Should you prefer to spend the evening in town, you can take the metro to Cirpo station (single trip 1 Euro) and take a taxi from there (approx 10 Euros) back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms, but distant from central Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the overal service perfect. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We unfortunately forgot some of our belongings in the room. One phonecall to the hotel after arriving home and it was all arranged.
reviews.title: Classy hotel!

likes.liked: — The service and view from the balcony of our room
likes.disliked: — The prices generally and the limited cooked breakfast items in the Executive lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All right, you will pay a good price for this hotel but it is worth every penny of it!
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel with amazing views
Plush but Expensive
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 4 day trip to Rome where we stayed at the Hilton Cavalieri.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is by far one of the nicest Hilton's I have stayed in, very plush marble foyier, fantastic indoor and outdoor swimming pools and excellent restaurants.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: The rooms are very opulent in their decoration and consist of Superking size bed, with a small living area and balcony and a fully marbled bathroom with 4 piece suite and dressing table.
reviews.title: Best in the World!

reviews.text: We were unfortunately, not able to get a City view room, so we overlooked the Hotel entrance. Quite a pleasant outlook, however, the view was somewhat spoilt by the enormous satellite tower which was directly outside the Hotel!
reviews.title: Simply amazing!

reviews.text: The Hotel is situated on the Vatican side of Rome and is located at the top of the hill. This means that if you wish to visit Rome or eat outside of the hotel you have to go by Taxi/mini-bus.
reviews.title: A Truly Great Hotel!

reviews.text: This place could be the setting for a Bond film from the 50's. Very stylish, not ultra modern, but definitely memorable. Staff were outstanding, the driver we arranged to collect us from the airport was worth the price for the entertainment value alone, and the bar staff were very attentive. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, and that was quite incredible. So much choice and exceptional quality. I'm sure dinner would be equally good. It is a little distance out of the centre - about 10 euros in a cab to the Vatican for example, but I think that the environment of peace and tranquility is well worth the trade off versus being in the hustle and bustle of the city. They run a free shuttle bus, so if you don't want to pay...
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: We had the cheapest rooms and they were amazing. God knows what the top spec ones must be like.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel for a Beautiful City

reviews.text: All in all, an excellent hotel that I would return to without hesitation.
reviews.title: outstanding service!
Top class hotel
reviews.text: I stayed in one of the 7th floor rooms with a King Imperial Rome View at the Rome Cavalieri for 7 days from Nov. 11-17, 2013, and I enjoyed every moment of it. Rome, Italy was the vacation that I have been dreaming of ever since grade school. I was finally able to fulfill my dream this year, so I read tons of hotel reviews and decided to reserve my room at the hotel with the best 5-stars reputation based on comments from other people who stayed there. I was not disappointed. First I was greeted by some very friendly staff as soon as my taxi pulled up to the doors. Their friendliness was beyond what I dreamed it would be. The concierge and door man greeted me as if I were royalty that day. Other days I was treated as if I were one of their beloved relatives who they were happy to see again. And the first-class service didn't end there. All of the hotel personnel were gracious and wonderful. The hotel is in a quiet spot and my room had an awesome view of several places I have only seen in pictures, on tv, and in the movies. I spent my first evening sitting on the balcony at looking the Vatican and thinking, "I can't believe I'm Really Here doing This". I even slept with the balcony doors open that night just to breath and feel Roman air. The free hotel shuttle to the city was timely, and the drivers were very kind and helpful about letting us know their schedules. Breakfast was included with my room and there were snacks provided throughout the day. My favorite evening snack during that week was curry chicken like I have never tasted before. The flavor of it was perfect and amazing. Every day I rode the hotel shuttle to the city and did my tourist thing. Bank of America has a branch location called BNL with an ATM just down the block (and on the same side of the street) from the shuttle drop-off spot. BNL is cross from the American Embassy. I used my ATM card to get Euros there a couple of times without any trouble. I was back at the hotel in the evenings. On the days I didn't feel like waiting for the shuttle to bring me back I caught a taxi. taxi stands are everywhere in Rome and there's one just across from the shuttle bus stop. There are also Metro Stops all around the square where the hotel shuttle dropped us off. Everything aspect of my trip to Rome either met or exceeded my expectations. I spent my evenings in the hotel room looking at Rome from my balcony and thanking God that the Ancient City is still here for us to enjoy.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - not good breakfast
reviews.text: Rome Vacation:

Our room was beautiful, I still have happy flashbacks of the spa, the breakfast was amazing, rooms were great, views were UNMATCHED. I'm glad I went big in Rome and decided on this hotel. Yes it was far from the airport, yes it is located on a hill. The key here is If you want that balance of relaxation in your vacation then this is perfect. There is a shuttle that takes you into the center of the city for free so just hop on and you're in the mix.
reviews.title: This hotel was a dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here during our Hooneymoon and it was the best hotel we stayed in! We were a little concerned about the fact that it was not in the middle of Rome but the free shuttle bus ran regularly and it only took about 20 minutes to get to downtown Rome. The rooms were a good size, great restaurants and fantastic views of Rome. We also enjoyed the pool and will definately be staying here next time we go to Rome!
reviews.title: Fantastic
Does Not Live Up to Hilton Standards: The WA staff would benefit from reading Conrad Hilton's , " Be My Guest",
reviews.text: The exterior of the hotel in the front is in need of major cosmetic repair. The dolphin water fountain has not been maintained, the backyard landscaping is not groomed to five star standard , or to basic standards for that matter. We requested a non smoking room and were placed in a smoking room. Our room was extremely hot when we checked and and noticed the air conditioner would not turn on. We called the front desk and inquired about the air. They said they do not turn on the air conditioner this time of the year. They said they would deliver fans for us to use in our room. And most insulting to our stay and experience is that we are Hilton Honors Diamond Status members and apparently this means nothing to Waldorf Astoria. I was left with the impression that Waldorf Astoria is a share partner of Hilton and members are treated equally and fairly.Instead, we were treated like third class citizens and as if we are a bother to them. When setting up our reservation for the hotel six months ago; we confirmed all benefits we would have as Diamond memebers including access to the lounge. When we arrived today, we were informed we could not have access the lounge. We asked to speak with the manager. The clerk assisting us said there was no manager available to assist us. Her name was Emilia Bangrazi and she states she did not understand why we were upset as she was just quoting their policy. As if this is an excuse to mistreat Diamond status customers who spend in excess of $20000 a year with Hilton and simply want to enjoy a lounge when at the hotel. If for a glass of water or to chat....Finally Emilia did get someone who was supposed to be in management, Martina Coletti. Martina explained that Emilia was in training and so was quoting the policy of Waldorf Astoria. Martina Coletti is just a Front Desk Supervisor and said she does not have any authority; however, the General Manager would be in at 3:00 and we would be able to address the matter with him at that time. We returned to the hotel in the afternoon and asked to speak with the General Manager. we were told that he was in a meeting and he would return a call afterward. An hour had passed and he had not returned a call. We called again asked to speak with the General Manager Nikoli Iakoni. This person to the phone and said as per policy of Waldorf Astoria; he could not allow us access to the lounge area unless we wanted to pay 69 euro per person per night to have access.....

This was a family trip for a week to Rome. Sitting atop Monte Mario, the hotel has an unbelievable view of Rome and Vatican City. We had a room on the view side and spent lots of time looking through binoculars from the private patio (completely closed on three sides, with mirrors on both sides accentuating the views) seeing where we were going or where we were every day. Bedding menus provide something like 10 different pillow types. An "airlock" sound door closes off the room from any hall noises. The staff was generous will still and sparkling water bottles every day. The breakfast buffet was astounding with pretty much all styles of breakfast from around the world represented. The spa was spectacular (we only had time for a tour, regrettably). The concierge services as well as the front desk for check in, check out and change, were excellent.
reviews.title: Excellence aloft in Rome

reviews.text: Note - the view comes with a small catch. This hotel is "outside the walls" and isn't the kind of place where you can just walk out the door and see the heart of Rome, and then head back mid-afternoon for a break. We found that getting into Rome and back, although easy, was essentially a day-long commitment (unless you want to catch a taxi back). The hotel has a courtesy shuttle that drops you in the heart of Rome (and returns). It runs once an hour. Tip: Don't show up at the last minute and expect to get on. We were turned away a couple of times due to capacity. We love to walk, though. After 24 hours of travel we were very ready to walk to Vatican City - but it's about a 30-45 minute walk. Several nights we walked back from the Vatican or from the Cipro Metro station - and it's uphill, after a day of already walking all over Rome. So - given where you are at the end of the day and the time, it may take time to get to the shuttle pick-up, and the timing has to be right. We found ourselves taking the shuttle in, but finding other ways to get back. Don't get me wrong - the shuttle's fantastic, the views are worth it, and we're glad we stayed there.
reviews.title: overpriced

reviews.text: We chose this hotel as it had a pool and we were travelling with 5 children aged between 13 years and 5 months. In fact it had a huge main pool (very deep and very cool) and also possibly the best baby and toddlers pool area I have encountered. The rooms were large and beautiful with a stunning view over the city. The staff simply couldn't have been more helpful with the children and our many and various requirements (cots, sterilisers, interconnecting rooms, kids entertainment at the sunday brunch, car seats etc). It is a 20 minute ride on the half hourly shuttle into the city so if you need to be central, this is probably not for you, but for any family with young children I don't think you could pick a better hotel in Rome.The downside....the bill!
reviews.title: perfect venue for citybreak with kids

reviews.text: The Rome Cavalieri Hilton was our first stop on a whirlwind trip of Italy's high points. The hotel stands out as one of those high points! As our driver from the airport wound around narrow city streets to finally arrive at the hotel in a hilltop neighborhood, we wondered what was in store. We joked that the Hilton had to look long and hard to find a random hilltop to build this hotel with the spectacular view. As Diamond members we reveled in the view from the club room, arguably one of the best club rooms that exists. With binoculars we found the Vatican and Colesseum and other notable landmarks. If you don't have club room privieges, I'm not sure how to access this same view. My best advice: work hard to become a Diamond member because this club room was amazing. The complimentary high quality food and beverages were gorgeously displayed, the service was first-rate and we had 15 minutes of free internet per day. Wandering the hotel interiors and exteriors is quite another peak experience. The owners art collection makes the hotel another Roman museum piece. Exquisite!
reviews.title: World-class hotel!

likes.liked: — Beauty, attention to detail, service, surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the shuttle service easy, friendly and reliable and were able to make full days of the sites and look forward to the club morning and evening views. Our room, though not city-view was a superb accomodation.
reviews.title: Can you say Bellissimo?
Fab but rude front desk
reviews.text: This hotel surely is a showpiece of the Hilton chain and a grand and pleasurable life experience.

First class resort. Stayed on Exec floor. Ask for odd-numbered rooms if possible (view of city and Vatican). Even if not, rooms are spacious, comfortable and well furnished. Exec lounge is top - great food all day long (desserts are great) including wine and drinks (need to ask - only basic well-drinks, but they have generally a full bar). Service is excellent. Concierge is very accommodating. Fitness gym is also tops - better than most US gym memberships! Sauna and turkish baths are great. Indoor (heated) pool is something out of ancient Rome. Outdoor pool (not heated) is also excellent. Service is great, but food / drink outdoors is very expensive (but who cares! You're on vacation for cryin' out loud!)
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in September 2007. I can honestly say this was the best hotel experience I've ever had. From our exclusive check-in as Hilton Honor members, to the wonderful poolside dinner for my birthday, to our late check out, it was a truly memorable time. Our room on the 7th Floor was palatial - unfortunately we overlooked the telecommunication tower and not the City, but as the room was on our points, that was okay. It also meant we had the setting sun on our balcony which was a bonus. The pool was large but unheated and the sun fell behind the hotel by late afternoon, thus making my evening swims very bracing. Drinks are expensive but this is a 5 star hotel and you get what you pay for. The service was impeccable. Each evening there was some form of entertainment by the pool, either a singer or pianist. The lobby bar also had a pianist playing. We tried to get into La Pergola but it was full so we ate outside by the pool in the "Giardino dell'Uliveto" Terrace restaurant and had a marvellous meal. The shuttle into the City was extremely useful although we had to take taxis back. They were not expensive - 10 Euro including tip. I would recommend this hotel for the following reaons:- the staff were very polite and attentive, the ambiance, the food, the location and the room were all exceptional.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: A great oasis 15 minutes drive from the crowds of city center Rome. From the beautiful fountain to the landscaping you know you have arrived at a great hotel. Everyone is well trained and most speak english well. The outdoor pool is beautiful, but the indoor pool with a fireplace is unique. The excercise room is so ultra modern and cool looking, i purchased a t-shirt just so I could workout.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great room , great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very well decorated. Quiet and even had rolling shutters that came down over the sliding glass doors to completely black out the room (great for late sleepers). The bathroom was large and covered in marble.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I've stayed at

likes.liked: — everything is top-notch-- bed, shower, view, food
likes.disliked: — hotel is out of the city

reviews.text: Althought VERY expensive, I highly recmnd the restaurants. The breakfast buffet was outrageous. Literally the biggest best breakfast ever.
reviews.title: Great/Decent Stay

reviews.text: Try and get a city view which overlooks the Vatican.
reviews.title: Excellent but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a long weekend in Rome you can't beat this hotel. Although not in the centre the panoramic views from its position on the hill are worth it. Free shuttle service for most of the day avoids need to get cabs. It's great to go back there in the evening and relax in the spa area. The Pergola restaurant is to die for, it is hard to summarise how magnificent the experience dining there is. All members of staff were so polite and helpful throughout the hotel. Will definitely return
reviews.title: Cavalieri Hotel Magnificent
Gives Waldorf a BAD name!!
reviews.text: What a disappointment!!! Old hotel and not a very modern facility. I paid over $36 for two gin & tonics. The pool waitress could not understand a word of English and never brought my beer.
No room upgrade that I wanted as a Diamond with Hilton.
reviews.title: Cheap and Tacky and overpriced

reviews.text: Do not stay here. Instead, go to Venice and stay in the Molino Stuckey Hilton.
reviews.title: A true 5 star hotel

reviews.text: To stay in a five star hotel should be an experience that is like no oner. But I found this place Tacky and money grabbing. maybe in five start hotels it is normal practise to walk into a room and leave the TV switch on and then charge €20 for using it. To then call through to connect to Wifi ( which is usually complimentary in many 2 or 3 star hotels) to be told it is €25. I would rather drink a bottle of wine from the mini bar. Perhaps a nice swim would make the experience a little more luxurious. NOPE! they also charge guests for that also. i found the place cheap ( they are constantly trying to charge you for things that I consider to be included in my nights stay) and Tacky.
reviews.title: Rude Customer service for such expensive hotel... Hate It!

reviews.text: If you don't mind taking a free 30-minute shuttle to and from the Piazza Barberini or splurging on cab fare every single time you leave the hotel, then by all means, stay here. Marble bathrooms, luxurious ambience. But if you plan to do more sightseeing than lounging around the hotel then this is not the right hotel. It's terribly far and very inaccessible. There are so many other nicer less expensive places to stay in Rome. And even if you are a guest, you pay extra to swim in the hotel pool. If you move anything in the minibar, you get charged. If you weren't allowed late check out and you kill time before your flight by sitting by the pool, you get charged. And please don't get me started about the NO FREE WIFI EVEN IN COMMON AREAS - even after paying a premium of over $300/night! Oh and check your bill when you check out. We were charged 40 euros (20 euros times two) for a minibar purchase when we didn't even take anything! And the minibar menu had no item worth 20 euros for that matter so I guess instead of having to explain what those 2 20euro items were, they just quickly removed the charges from our bill. Again, this might be a good last choice unless you're a famous celeb hiding from the paparazzi.
reviews.title: Beautiful, expensive, and very very far from everything.

reviews.text: Visited this hotel for four nights during a conference in September 2013.
reviews.title: Grand Waldorf Astoria Property!

reviews.text: Booked a well sized room on the Imperial Lounge level - the Imperial Club Rooms come with some upgraded benefits and the delight and convenience of several food presentations held in the lounge throughout the day.
reviews.title: Lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an Imperial Club guest one can choose to eat in the large restaurant for breakfast downstairs or in the smaller Club Lounge on the 6th floor. The Club Lounge is designed to be somewhat exclusive and not over crowded and is the place to start when it opens in the morning for one of the best cappuccinos around town!
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel with superb staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast in the Club Lounge, of course, is on a smaller scale but covers items such as imported smoked salmon and a large selection of fruits, cereals and pastries. I found the presentations during the day to be of top quality and the lounge was a very nice facility to enjoy. The view from the lounge is second to none overseeing the city of Rome from its several balconies.
reviews.title: outstanding
wish i had had more time to enjoy this
reviews.text: I loved the hotel beautiful view of rome also from the terrace where there is the breakfast room. breakfast was ample, the bed was ultra soft. there is a shuttle bus into the city and a taxi to the train station is around 13 euros, you can get there pretty fast since the taxis go through the villa borghese where no other cars are allowed through.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was also wonderful
reviews.title: The finest Hilton in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at Hiltons all of the world. This is the best. The room was very large with a balcony and floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city.
reviews.title: Great Luxury Base for a Short Stayin Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was beautiful - with a great pool and very nice gym.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: The restaurant is amazing.
reviews.title: Petronius Suite is the sweet life !!

likes.disliked: — Price of the food and beverage

reviews.text: After a long trip through Italy, you realize one thing...if you want to stay at a nice hotel, you will pay for it. After many nights on small and uncomfortable beds, we decided to splurge in Rome for three nights at the Hilton. The hotel is beautifully luxurious. The hallways are covered in marble, the chandeliers are magnificent, and the views of Rome are amazing. However, there are a few things we did not enjoy about this hotel. First of all, they make you pay for the gym facilities. We were very excited to lift weights and perhaps use the treadmill after weeks of carbs....but once we found out that the gym cost 25 euros a day, we decided to ignore the urge to exercise. Also, the hotel is quite far from the city centre. The hotel does have a shuttle, but it is generally full...and it does not operate late enough to catch a ride after dinner and drinks. So, expect to drop some cab money. One day, we decided to ride the bus to the train station, then ride the train to the city centre...but it took some time to walk to the bus stop, wait for the bus, ride the bus to the train station, wait for the train, and ride the train all the way to the city. Though we really enjoyed the beds, we also would have enjoyed the beds at the St. Regis, which is right inside the town. I'd definitely recommend getting a nice hotel in the city centre...since they are no more expensive than the Hilton.
reviews.title: Luxurious with a bad location

reviews.text: First some background, I am a Hilton Diamond Member. I stayed here using points and notified the hotel the trip was to celebrate my birthday.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pre stay communication: very responsive, notofied me that I would be upgraded and gave me all the information I needed regarding area and transporation.
reviews.title: One of the Best Hiltons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In: upon I arrival I was directed to the VIP check In once I notified them of my name. Check In was pleasant with host informing about my room witha view, access to Executive Lounge and Spa Usage. I was then escorted up to the room and show the Executive Lounge.
reviews.title: Great but not perfect

likes.disliked: — far away from town, everything was very expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: I was given an Executive Room Plus with acces to Lounge and an incredible view of Rome with Saint Peter's Basilica in the foreground. The room was large set up in Junior Suite format--aproximately 500 square feet. All Marbe Bathroom with a very comfortable King Sized Bed.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

likes.liked: — The whole hotel was just incredible!
likes.disliked: — That I couldn't take it home with me!

reviews.text: Specatular 5 Star Hotel!!!! Waldorf Astoria Quality. Personnel and Staff- Superb!!! Polite, Professional, (Generally) Multi-Lingual, Excellent Service, Beautiful View of Downtown Rome from This Location!!! Shuttle to Piazza Barbieri Very Helpful, Provides Round Trip Service with about 30 minutes to Downtown, 30 Minutes (slightly less) Return from Downtown. Shuttle Driver- The Example of Courtesy and Professionalism!!!!
reviews.title: Rome Cavalieri April 2013

reviews.text: Only Downside, and Not a Significant Factor- Not Convenient to Central Rome Locations (Really Need A Shuttle or Taxi to Return to Hotel), but UPSIDE of this- QUIET!!! Away from the Noise and Bustle of Central Rome (and MOST of Rome)!!! If you have Had Enough of Dodging Motorscooters and Crossing the Noisy Plaza Crosswalks with Taxis, Buses, Motorcycles and Smart Cars Zipping By at 50+ Km/Hour, then the Rome Cavalieri REALLY DOES get you AWAY from all that!!! (and after 10 - 12 Hours of Walking ALL OVER ROME during Each Day, getting Away from that "Busy-Ness" was REALLY APPRECIATED!!!
reviews.title: What a view of Roma!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite Expensive, I would agree taht using the 4 $$$$ rating would be appropriate, but Here you DEFINITELY get what you pay for!!!! If you are going to be Staying IN Rome, and Don't Have to stay on a "Motel 6" Budget, the Rome Cavalieri Should Be On Your "Short List"!!!
reviews.title: Fit for a king!

reviews.text: Thanks.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: Jim N from Bellevue, WA
reviews.title: A MASTERPIECE but why pay for Mineral Water and Wireless?

aka: Rome Cavalieri, Waldorf Astoria Hotels And Resorts
description: Overlooking the panorama that has inspired visitors for centuries is Rome's most prestigious address – the Rome Cavalieri hotel. Though only minutes from the city's great monuments, the Rome Cavalieri has the tranquility of an oasis. Enclosed in fifteen acres of lush Mediterranean parklands, this luxury hotel is a calm retreat in the heart of the Eternal City, an elegant refuge where time slows and hearts quicken.The first hotel in Europe to be part of the exclusive Waldorf Astoria Hotels & Resorts, the Rome Cavalieri hotel is more than just a 5–star property. It's the pre-eminent luxury hotel in Rome, with an art collection that outshines many museums, a Grand Spa that would be the envy of a prestige health resort, and standards of luxury that set it apart from other Rome hotels. The Rome Cavalieri brings new meaning to notions of Italian style, and new purpose to the fine art of exclusive hospitality.
